polimi.reds.broker.overlay
Interface Transport

All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractTransport, TCPTransport
public interface Transport

The interface of the data-link layer of a REDS broker. Objects implementing this interface manages the connections between the local node and its neighbors, offering methods to send and receive data (i.e., any Serializable object). Each data item has an associated subject (a String) that can be used by the upper layers to distinguish between different kind of data. Classes that implement this interface differ for the type of protocol they use to connect and exchange data items.

Method Detail

start

void start()
           throws java.io.IOException
Starts this Transport. Transports must be started before performing every other operation.

Throws:
java.io.IOException - if something goes wrong setting up the components to accept incoming connections.

stop

void stop()
          throws java.io.IOException
Stops this Transport.

Throws:
java.io.IOException - if something goes wrong stopping the transport.

isRunning

boolean isRunning()
Checks whether this Transport is running (i.e., it has been started and not yet stopped).

Returns:
true if this transport is running, false otherwise.

setBeaconing

void setBeaconing(boolean beaconing)
Activates and deactivates the beaconing mechanism to check the status of links. If beaconing is active the node requires data to arrive periodically to keep the connection alive and periodically send data.

Parameters:
beaconing - true to enable the beaconing mechanism, false otherwise.

isBeaconing

boolean isBeaconing()
Checks whether the beaconing mechanism is active.

Returns:
true if the beaconing mechanism is active, false otherwise.
See Also:
setBeaconing(boolean)

getUrls

java.lang.String[] getUrls()
Gets the URLs associated with this transport.

Returns:
the URLs associated with this transport.

knowsProtocol

boolean knowsProtocol(java.lang.String protocol)
Checks whether this transport knows the given protocol. This method can be used to decide if this transport is able to speak the given protocol, and consequently it can be used to open links toward a node identified by an URL characterized by such protocol.

Parameters:
protocol - the protocol to check.
Returns:
true if this transport knows the given protocol, false otherwise.

openLink

Link openLink(java.lang.String url)
              throws java.net.MalformedURLException,
                     java.net.ConnectException,
                     NotRunningException
Opens a new link with the node located at the specified URL. If everything goes right the new link is opened and the OpenLinkListeners registered are notified of the new link, otherwise an exception is thrown.

Parameters:
url - The URL of the node.
Returns:
The new link.
Throws:
java.net.MalformedURLException - if the url is not a valid REDS URL.
java.net.ConnectException - if the connection cannot be opened.
NotRunningException - if the transport is not running.

getOpenLinks

java.util.Collection<Link> getOpenLinks()
Gets the collection of all links opened (and not yet closed) so far.

Returns:
the collection of all links opened (and not yet closed) so far.

addDataListener

void addDataListener(DataListener listener,
                     java.lang.String subject)
Registers a listener for the arrival of new data addressed to the given subject. If the listener (i.e., a listener that equals this one) was added before this operation has no effect.

Parameters:
listener - the component to be notified when new data arrive.
subject - the subject to listen for.

addConnectivityChangeListener

void addConnectivityChangeListener(ConnectivityChangeListener listener)
Registers a listener for connectivity changes. Registers a listener for the events of opening/closing/crashing of links. If the listener (i.e., a listener that equals this one) was added before this operation has no effect.

Parameters:
listener - the component to be notified when connectivity changes.

removeDataListener

void removeDataListener(DataListener listener,
                        java.lang.String subject)
Removes the given listener. Removes the first DataListener (among those registered for the given subject) that equals the one passed as a parameter.

Parameters:
listener - the listener to be removed.
subject - the subject the listener to be removed was registered to.

removeConnectivityChangeListener

void removeConnectivityChangeListener(ConnectivityChangeListener listener)
Removes the given listener. Removes the first registered ConnectivityChangeListener that equals the one passed as a parameter.

Parameters:
listener - the listener to be removed
